holidays.name: Left-Handers Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the unique talents and quirks of left-handed people in a right-handed world.
holidays.origin: Started in 1976 by Dean R. Campbell to promote awareness of the challenges left-handed people face and to celebrate their distinctiveness.
holidays.funFact: Approximately 10% of the world's population is left-handed, making them a quirky minority! On this day, lefties often try using right-handed tools to show how tricky they can be.

holidays.name: International Lefthanders Rule Day
holidays.description: An unofficial extension of Left-Handers Day but with a more rebellious twist, encouraging lefties to 'rule' the day by showing off their creative dominance.
holidays.origin: A playful spin on Left-Handers Day that emerged from internet communities to celebrate the lefty lifestyle with a bit more swagger.
holidays.funFact: Some lefties claim they have enhanced creativity and problem-solving skills ‚Äî and on this day, they put those claims to the test!

holidays.origin: An American food holiday created by culinary enthusiasts to honor one of the most prized cuts of steak in fine dining.

holidays.name: National Prosecco Day
holidays.description: A sparkling celebration of the Italian sparkling wine Prosecco! Time to pop bottles and toast with bubbles.
holidays.origin: A fun, unofficial holiday embraced by wine lovers and Italian culture enthusiasts worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Prosecco comes mainly from northeastern Italy and is traditionally made using the Charmat method, which preserves its fresh and fruity bubbles.
